docs.text: when robert forster found himself famous again after appearing in " jackie brown " , he immediately signed up for a little film called " american perfekt " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this was almost two years ago .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i waited patiently for the film to be released , but it never was .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: finally , i forgot about it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the other day , though , while i was perusing the selection of the local video store , i stumbled upon , you guessed it , " american perfekt " .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i immediately rented it and with a certain amount of glee , rushed home to view it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: having now seen the film , i understand why it never saw theatrical release .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " american perfekt " is a jumbled mess .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the storyline is non-existent .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it took me half the movie just to figure out what was going on .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and at that point , the only thing i really knew for sure was that the movie was * never * going to introduce a plot of some sort .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it wants to get by on quirkyness and so-called charm alone , and it just doesn't work .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: robert forster plays a psychiatrist who picks up amanda plummer , and they head off on the road together .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: along the way to no discernable destination , they run into all sorts of kooky and wacky characters .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i suppose this free-wheeling , no plot style is supposed to give the film an element of danger and excitment , but all it did was make me sleepy .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'm all for trying new things within the realm of film , but not at the expense of coherence .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: nothing in this movie makes sense .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the actions of the characters go unexplained , even when they're truly bizarre .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i'll give you an example , without giving too much away .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: david thewlis has a part as a drifting con-man .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: at one point , mid-way through the movie , he runs forster and plummer off the road with his car .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: as he passes them , we see that his face is covered in blood .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: do you think we would get an explanation as to what happened to him ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you would think so , wouldn't you .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " american perfekt " is a waste of time .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: nothing is gained from watching this movie , except maybe a migraine .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and if you do rent it , don't bother trying to figure out what's going on in the hopes that everything will be resolved by the end .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: this doesn't happen .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and no explanation is given for the misspelling of " perfect " , either .
docs.label: negative
